td.content: s:patient presents with mild cough and mild fever for 11 days. patient is a female retired aged 65 years. o:Height 62 in, Weight 208 lbs, Temperature 98.1 F, Pulse 84, SystolicBP 112, DiastolicBP 75, Respiration 17, nose = no nasal congestion, wheeze-LU, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, all lung fields a:Shortness of Breath p:performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed, and prescribed OMS - 50 DEMAND OXYGEN nasal cannula, and ordered Chest X-Ray.

s:female retired aged 66 years complains of mild fever x 2 weeks. NKDA. o:Height 61 in, Weight 201 lbs, Temperature 98.6 F, Pulse 79, SystolicBP 105, DiastolicBP 64, Respiration 15, nose = no nasal congestion, wheeze-LU, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, all lung fields a:Shortness of Breath p:performed E/M Level 2 (established patient) - Completed, and prescribed OMS - 50 DEMAND OXYGEN nasal cannula, and ordered FEV1, FEV1/FVC, Pulse Oximetry.
